id: ESPN's Matthew Berry had a funny, profanity-laced rant for angry Todd Gurley fantasy ownersESPN's Matthew Berry had a funny, profanity-laced rant for angry Todd Gurley fantasy ownersESPN's Matthew Berry had a funny, profanity-laced rant for angry Todd Gurley fantasy owners
paragraph:

	By Andy Nesbitt
October 30, 2018 7:03 pm

		By: Andy Nesbitt		| October 30, 2018 7:03 pm		

A lot of fantasy football owners (and gamblers) weren’t too happy when Todd Gurley pulled up at the 4-yard line in the final seconds of last Sunday’s game.The Rams start running back could have easily walked into the end zone but instead he opted to stay in play and get tackled inside the 5 yard line. The move allowed the Rams to run out the clock and beat the Packers 29-27.Fantasy owners who had Gurley in their lineups would have loved another TD from Gurley. And Matthew Berry, ESPN’s fantasy guy, has a message for those people: @matthewberrytmr feels some type of way about Fantasy managers with Todd Gurley on their roster.A post shared by  SportsNation (@sportsnation) on Oct 29, 2018 at 6:46pm PDTThat’s a pretty rant right there. And probably hits a little too close to home for some of you who took Le’Veon Bell early in your drafts.
